ai.summary: Leitir Fura Trail is a moderate ~8.9 km hike in the UK offering varied terrain and a steady pace. The route combines grassy tracks, woodland paths, and some rocky sections, making it suitable for hikers with intermediate fitness and good balance.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail features mixed surfaces: leaf-strewn woodland paths, grassy moorland, muddy/boggy patches after rain, and short exposed rock slabs. Footing can be uneven with gentle to moderate elevation changes; expect occasional steeper sections.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof hiking boots and dress in layers. Carry a map and compass (or GPS) and know how to use them; stay on marked paths where possible. Bring sufficient water and snacks; be prepared for sudden weather changes and muddy or boggy ground. Mobile reception can be limited in remote sections—inform someone of your plan and expected return. Watch for wildlife and respect livestock if encountered.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass (or GPS) and knowledge of navigation
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) are typically best for this hike in the UK; winter hikes require careful planning and winter equipment.

seo.title: Leitir Fura Trail – 8.9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Leitir Fura Trail in the UK. An ~8.9 km moderate hike featuring mixed terrain, practical safety tips, and essential gear to plan your trip.
